content: I've changed "A word doesn't count if anyone else has also written it." to "A word doesn't count if more than one person writes it." based on the feedback on the forum: https://forum.codingame.com/t/community-puzzle-boggle-with-friends/202966/6

There's an extra space after NOBLE in Chandler's line for Validator 2.  If you check the length of the words for any shorter than 3 it works but your constraints indicate that all the words are "at least 3-letters long".

The difficulty goes up compared to your previous puzzles. We are far from an easy puzzle which should have been classified as CoC ^^

Well done.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice puzzle with a good set of tests. From the first glance it looked more like an "easy" one, but running test showed that it needs a more complicated solution.
Test 2 and Validator 3 contain empty lines at the end of the input

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great puzzle, very clear description + there's online resources if you're not sure about something. Awesome tests. Also the game of boggle looks super fun to play IRL, and if I do play I'll have my own referee üí™

I love the puzzle and the tests and validators look super nice and high effort as always. My only complaint is that I think there should be more tests. For example, I noticed your code wouldn't pass this one (it doesn't find the word):

Z Z D E
D D D D
D D D Z
A D D Z
1
Monica writes: ADDDDDE
I think it would be better if the needed output was shortened in some way. I do not think so many details are needed.For example just ask for the winner and its score?

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good medium-level puzzle, with plenty of scope for the player to make, then debug and learn from, errors :)

Goal
* Heading "Rules and Scoring": Suggest to format "valid" as <<bold>>.

* Heading "Rules and Scoring": Suggest to remove the brackets for the 3rd point.

* Heading "Rules and Scoring": Suggest to delete "Of course".

* Heading "Assume": Suggest to delete "All words are at least 3 letters long." (a) It's not an assumption; it's a fact. (b) It's already mentioned in Constraints.

* After the deletion, it isn't necessary to use bullet points any more. "You can assume" and "All words on‚Ä¶" may be merged as a single sentence.

Output
* Please add "separated by a space" after "total score".

* Please add "separated by a space" after "word's value".

Constraints
* Suggest to add that [[numOfFriends]] ‚â• 2.

* Suggest to add that all letters on the Boggle Board and the words in [[aFriendsNotePad]] are in uppercase.

* Suggest to add that all [[Friend]]s' names consist of one word only and are all unique.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

Thanks.
Thanks 5DN1L -- You're the best.  I will work thru these today.
Thanks!

Thanks for the feedback.

The reason I have so much output is to help people with troubleshooting, so it‚Äôs not overly frustrating.

If the right answer is: Joey wins with 20 points and you‚Äôve got Joey wins with 21 points, where do you even begin to troubleshoot that, other than starting at the beginning.

Hey, thanks for the feedback. 

My defense on that is:
You are correct, that my code doesn‚Äôt work if the grid has more than nine of a specific letter (like D).  However, the boggle board cubes are such that that could never possibly happen.  In other words fewer than 10 of the cubes have a D on them.
Thanks.   I have now fixed that.
Thanks üò∫

Hey, thanks for the feedback. 

I‚Äôm looking at it right now and I definitely do not see a space after NOBLE

Maybe someone else fixed it. Please let me know if it continues to be an issue
You're right, thanks for explaining. Approved! üòÄüëç
OK, but don't NIL me üòÇ It's 5DN1L.
haha, okay :)
Done now, I believe :)
